intro: Pedicularis longicalyx, commonly known as the long-stemmed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are alternate and often have a glandular appearance, contributing to its unique botanical features. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
